intro: Psychotria leucocalyx, commonly known as white-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in rainforests or undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
